page.title: 07Canvey - The Lake (2)
page.content: The lake is generally supposed to have been an old creek dating from the time when{Canvey Island}was a collection of smaller islands before embankment. It was cut off from the sea by the Knightswick Road part of an old sea wall but now it is a freshwater lake. Remains of old oyster shells have been dredged up from its depths, a reminder of what the lake was probably used for in Roman times. The lake is three quarters of a mile in length and a long curved narrow shape. people cross the lake by snakes bridge at the western end. The lake has extensive reed and rush growth along its margin and provides haven for wild life in its inaccessible parts.The muddy clay bottom is 5m. deep in parts.The water is shallow - only about 0.5m.
